snippet: Government forces, backed by the Lebanese militia Hezbollah, have spent weeks edging toward Yabrud, a critical transit point for militants, refugees and arms heading in and out of Lebanon.
abstract: Opponent activists in Syria say that Abu Azzam al-Kuwaiti, leader of insurgent group Nusra Front, has been killed in combat with Syrian government forces as they continue their push into rebel-held town of Yabrud, near the Lebanon border.
lead_paragraph: Government forces, backed by the Lebanese militia Hezbollah, have spent weeks edging toward Yabrud, a critical transit point for militants, refugees and arms heading in and out of Lebanon.

headline.main: Syrian Forces Close to Taking Over Long-Held Rebel Town
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces Close to Taking Over Long-Held Rebel Town
